Package fr.uge.net.tcp.nonblocking.reader

Interface Reader<T>

Type Parameters:
T - the type of the element this reader take care of.
All Known Implementing Classes:
HTTPLineReader, HTTPReader, PacketReader, StringReader
public interface Reader<T>

A reader is an object that take a buffer (in write-mode) as input and process it to obtain an element of type T.

The method process(ByteBuffer) will read from the buffer until it has completed his task. In this case, it will return Reader.ProcessStatus.DONE. But if the buffer doesn't contain enough data, the reader will conserve what has been read so far and will return Reader.ProcessStatus.REFILL. If process(ByteBuffer) encounter an error the method will return Reader.ProcessStatus.ERROR. The errors need to be explicitly specified in the implementations of Reader.

The method get() can be used to obtain the processed element only if process(ByteBuffer) return Reader.ProcessStatus.DONE. Otherwise the behaviour is undefined. Each call of the get() method need to return the same value if no other method are called.

The method reset() reset the Reader in it's initial state.

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type Interface Description
    static class  Reader.ProcessStatus
    Current state of the reader.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    T get()

    Processes data from the buffer to create an object.
    void reset()

  • Method Details

    • process

      Reader.ProcessStatus process​(java.nio.ByteBuffer bb)
      Processes data from the buffer to create an object.
      Parameters:
      bb - the buffer where to read data. Must be in write-mode.
      Returns:
      the current state of the reader.

    • get

      T get()
      Returns:
      the processed element.

    • reset

      void reset()
      Reset the reader in it's initial state. Ready to read new data.
